content.prompt: Which of the following best explains how the government of the United Kingdom maintains political legitimacy despite the lack of a written constitution?

choices.label: By national mandate, monarchy will be gradually phased out of power by elected representatives within the next two decades.
A direct, popular election of the chief executive occurs every five years.
There is public support of military leaders who take over political leadership in times of instability.
There is a long-standing legal tradition of protecting civil liberties and representative government at the national level.

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Explain how political systems, principles, institutions, processes, policies, and behaviors apply in a course country.
